intro: Spermacoce aquatica, commonly known as water spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist environments such as wetlands and stream banks. Botanically, it belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species.
